alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windham; Western Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 7:02PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Windham County through 745 PM EDT... At 702 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Heath, or 13 miles southwest of Brattleboro, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Brattleboro, Townshend, Putney, Westminster, Newfane, Guilford Center, Guilford, Whitingham, Marlboro, Halifax, Brookline, Jacksonville, South Newfane, East Dummerston, East Putney, Fairview Village, Williamsville, East Dover, Four Corners and Dummerston Center. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
